Title: Aizu Monogatari (Tales of Aizu)
Author: Shimazu =
Masayoshi
E-mail: patriot014@...
Source: Original
Main character(s)=
: Tokugawa Hirotada and Matsumae Yuki.
Archived on the website:  NO
General=
 Rating:  G...just in Aizu Castle.

Aizu Castle
April, Heisei 17 (2005)

The white walls of Aizu Castle =
rose majestically over the
ferroconcrete city skyline, lost in their own ag=
e-old mystery. A wind
blew from the northeast, and all was peaceful, with t=
he air awash in
the scent of spring. In the cemeteries, the ghosts of the m=
en and
women of old Aizu kept watch over the spirit of the new Aizu. In the=

fields where life once lay dying, the tall grass was truly "all that
remai=
ned of warriors' dreams."
Pausing on the bridge over the castle moat, Tokug=
awa Hirotada gazed
quietly at the sloping eaves of the tower. The fishlike =
talismans on
the very top of the highest roof seemed to stretch skyward in =
a quiet
prayer for peaceful rest.
"Tragic=85" he murmured. "Tragic indeed."=

Hiro felt an urge to stay there, to contemplate the deep sadness of
the ca=
stle tower, to let its mystery seep into his soul, but he had a
job to do. =
Tugging smartly at his haori overcoat, he resumed his brisk
stride across t=
he bridge, soon passing through the gate and into the
inner circle. Directl=
y below the slope of the tower's stone base sat a
shallow pit, with several=
 men and women in dusty clothing digging and
brushing away at the rich brow=
n soil. One of them caught his eye, and
he waved.
	"Hi, Yuki!"
	A short, en=
ergetic woman in the deepest part of the pit waved back,
brushing her long =
bangs away from her eyes.
	"Hi! Be with you in a minute!" Exchanging a shor=
t word with the
supervisor, she picked up her cloth shoulderbag and clamber=
ed out of
the pit to join him. Exchanging a quiet kiss, they left the inner=

circle of the castle, hand in hand.
